intro: Fimbristylis oxystachya, commonly known as narrowleaf spikerush, is a flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its rhizomes help it spread and establish dense colonies in suitable environments. Fimbristylis oxystachya plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
